name: BUIKA - Live in Concert
description: Known for her powerful voice and unique blend of flamenco, jazz, soul, and Afro-Caribbean rhythms, Grammy-nominated Spanish vocalist  Buika has captivated audiences around the world. This special performance marks her highly anticipated return to Canada and promises an emotionally moving concert that transcends musical borders.

name: Trees Around the Branch Tour at Agincourt Library

location.name: Trees Around the Branch Tour at Agincourt Library

description:
Explore the trees and green spaces around the Agincourt branch with City of Toronto Urban Forestry staff. Take a guided neighborhood walk to learn how to identify local tree species and understand their role in the urban environment, from cultural connections to ecological benefits.

Children under 12 must be accompanied by a parent/caregiver. Please note that the tour will start and end at the Agincourt library and will be guided by the City of Toronto Urban Forestry staff. There may be uneven, unpaved surfaces along the route outside and around the neighbourhood. Please dress and prepare accordingly for this outdoor program (e.g., hats, sunscreen, water, comfortable shoes). 

This program takes place rain or shine. In the event of severe inclement weather, please register with the branch to be notified of an alternative date. Registration is required. Please contact the branch by phone or in person to register.

name: Little Canada Halloween Mini Mission
description:
Hidden throughout our miniature world are spooky little Halloween scenes, each with a letter next to it. Collect all the letters, unscramble the riddle and unlock the final phrase. It's an adventure full of tiny chills, big thrills and mysterious fun for everyone.

Are you ready to begin the hunt?

name: Where The Wild Things Are
description:
Let the WILD Rumpus Begin!

Hot on the heels of last year's sold-out sensation, Max and the Wild Things roar back to the YPT stage. Embark on a magical interactive journey as you help transform Max's bedroom into the legendary land of the Wild Things! Crowned their king, Max faces a big decision: rule the rumpus or return home? Based on Maurice Sendak's beloved storybook, this adaptation is an interactive experience. 

Audience members will be seated around the performance area on three large mats, with limited chairs provided at the back for grownups who may require a seat.
